content.description: Ascend some cool pinches on the arete left of the Death Crimp Project. Really nice climbing on some cool holds.  The line has a single cold shut at the top.
content.location: The arete left of the Death Crimp Project

content.description: This line is a variation of the Cheat Cannon, though it was actually the original line that was first tried on the boulder, being much more obvious than the Cheat Cannon.  Start on the slab mantle start of the Cheat Cannon, but instead of dynoing straight up to a sloping ledge, do a huge sideways dyno out right to the lone jug on the wall.  Hit the sloping topout rail, and traverse left to mantle for the topout.  The dyno is very committing, and quite big, but can easily be protected with two pads, but preferably three.
content.location: Same start as the Cheat Cannon, but dyno right.

content.description: Start on good holds just left of the Cheat Cannon, and work your way right up the rail and arete to share topouts with the Cheat Cannon.  After completing the first ascent, the line was given V4, but repeating the line proved to be rather difficult.  It must've been a low gravity day.  The line was upgraded to V6.  If not overshadowed by the Cheat Cannon, this would be held in higher regard.
content.location: Start on jugs left of the Cheat Cannon and finish at the same topout point.

content.description: Climb the super crimpy overhanging face on some vicious holds. This line has been tried several times with no success.
content.location: Further down the trail from the Cheat Cannon, there is a quality moderate arete on the left side of the trail.  Turn into the rhodos at this boulder, and the next large boulder behind it is where you can find this project.  The left arete on the same boulder has an excellent V3-4 with one cold shut at the top.

content.description: This is one of the craziest, wildest boulders around, and one of the best in the region.  Sit start on two obvious holds, and mantle up onto the slab bulge utilizing a horrendous credit card undercling crimp. Once established on the slab, commit to an all-points-off dyno straight up to a sloping rail.  Once you stick it, dyno again to a bomber jug at the lip and get rewarded with an easy topout. So sick!
content.location: Follow the logging road downhill below the main cliff band, and you will eventually see the clean overhanging face of the Cheat Cannon about 20 feet to the left side of the trail.  Coordinates: 39.633572 N, -79.837391 W
